intro: Heteronoma cubense, commonly known as the Cuban horse chestnut, is a deciduous tree native to Cuba. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy white flowers. The tree produces smooth, greenish-brown fruits that contain spiny seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and can grow up to 20 meters in height. The plant is adapted to warm, tropical climates and prefers well-drained soils.
